list.name: Default Changelist
list.comment:
Small change to controlmanager.
One substantive change: - changed goSavedSt to also update "iCurrSt", which has the effect of ending the state transition without executing the state entry actions. That seems to be logically correct, and also lets play/pause work.
Some non-substantive changes: - The function "stIdx" appears to simply assert that the argument is a valid state index (and returns it). I made that explicit in the name, "assertValidState" - Added some spacing for legibility. - Made a few variable names more meanigful, and added comments for comprehension.

task.summary:
Implement an "AudioStart" event.
Because the current implementation of the state machine ignores transitions to the same state, we need to change states to actually do anything. When we change to the next or previous message, we need to move to a different state than "NetMessage", so that we can go to the (yet) next message before the current message stops. The "AudioStart" event lets us implement a "Playing" state, from which we can navigate.

Implement an "AudioStart" event.
Because the current implementation of the state machine ignores transitions to the same state, we need to change states to actually do anything. When we change to the next or previous message, we need to move to a different state than "NetMessage", so that we can go to the (yet) next message before the current message stops. The "AudioStart" event lets us implement a "Playing" state, from which we can navigate.

Small change to controlmanager.
One substantive change: - changed goSavedSt to also update "iCurrSt", which has the effect of ending the state transition without executing the state entry actions. That seems to be logically correct, and also lets play/pause work.
Some non-substantive changes: - The function "stIdx" appears to simply assert that the argument is a valid state index (and returns it). I made that explicit in the name, "assertValidState" - Added some spacing for legibility. - Made a few variable names more meanigful, and added comments for comprehension.

MESSAGE.value:
Implement an "AudioStart" event.
Because the current implementation of the state machine ignores transitions to the same state, we need to change states to actually do anything. When we change to the next or previous message, we need to move to a different state than "NetMessage", so that we can go to the (yet) next message before the current message stops. The "AudioStart" event lets us implement a "Playing" state, from which we can navigate.

Small change to controlmanager.
One substantive change: - changed goSavedSt to also update "iCurrSt", which has the effect of ending the state transition without executing the state entry actions. That seems to be logically correct, and also lets play/pause work.
Some non-substantive changes: - The function "stIdx" appears to simply assert that the argument is a valid state index (and returns it). I made that explicit in the name, "assertValidState" - Added some spacing for legibility. - Made a few variable names more meanigful, and added comments for comprehension.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Small change to controlmanager.
One substantive change: - changed goSavedSt to also update "iCurrSt", which has the effect of ending the state transition without executing the state entry actions. That seems to be logically correct, and also lets play/pause work.
Some non-substantive changes: - The function "stIdx" appears to simply assert that the argument is a valid state index (and returns it). I made that explicit in the name, "assertValidState" - Added some spacing for legibility. - Made a few variable names more meanigful, and added comments for comprehension.
